addHeaders(bytes,bytes).details: We check integrity and consistency of the header chain

params._anchor: The header immediately preceeding the new chain
params._headers: A tightly-packed list of 80-byte Bitcoin headers

addHeaders(bytes,bytes).return: True if successfully written, error otherwise

addHeadersWithRetarget(bytes,bytes,bytes.details: Checks the retarget, the heights, and the linkage

params._headers: A tightly-packed list of 80-byte Bitcoin headers
params._oldPeriodEndHeader: The last header in the difficulty period being closed
params._oldPeriodStartHeader: The first header in the difficulty period being closed

addHeadersWithRetarget(bytes,bytes,bytes.return: True if successfully written, error otherwise

constructor.details: We don't check this AT ALL really. Don't use relays with bad genesis

params._periodStart: The hash of the first header in the genesis epoch

findAncestor(bytes32,uint256).details: Will fail if the header is unknown

params._digest: The header digest to search for

findAncestor(bytes32,uint256).return: The height of the header, or error if unknown

findHeight(bytes32).details: Will fail if the header is unknown

params._digest: The header digest to search for

findHeight(bytes32).return: The height of the header, or error if unknown

getBestKnownDigest().details: This updated only by calling markNewHeaviest
getBestKnownDigest().return: The hash of the best marked chain tip

getCurrentEpochDifficulty().details: This is updated when a new heavist header has a new diff

getLastReorgCommonAncestor().details: This is updated only by calling markNewHeaviest
getLastReorgCommonAncestor().return: The hash of the shared ancestor of the most recent fork

getPrevEpochDifficulty().details: This is updated when a difficulty change is accepted
getPrevEpochDifficulty().return: The difficulty of the previous epoch

getRelayGenesis().return: The hash of the first block of the relay

isAncestor(bytes32,bytes32,uint256).details: Limit the amount of lookups (and thus gas usage) with _limit

params._limit: The maximum number of blocks to check

isAncestor(bytes32,bytes32,uint256).return: true if ancestor is at most limit blocks lower than descendant, otherwise false

markNewHeaviest(bytes32,bytes,bytes,uint.details: We don't check this AT ALL really. Don't use relays with bad genesis

params._ancestor: The digest of the most recent common ancestor
params._limit: Limit the amount of traversal of the chain
params._newBest: The 80-byte header to mark as the new best

markNewHeaviest(bytes32,bytes,bytes,uint.return: True if successfully updates bestKnownDigest, error otherwise

addHeaders(bytes,bytes).notice: Adds headers to storage after validating

addHeadersWithRetarget(bytes,bytes,bytes.notice: Adds headers to storage, performs additional validation of retarget

methods.constructor: Gives a starting point for the relay

findAncestor(bytes32,uint256).notice: Finds an ancestor for a block by its digest

findHeight(bytes32).notice: Finds the height of a header by its digest

isAncestor(bytes32,bytes32,uint256).notice: Checks if a digest is an ancestor of the current one

markNewHeaviest(bytes32,bytes,bytes,uint.notice: Gives a starting point for the relay
